text:
Gezapft im Porterhouse Pub in Dublin (Temple Bar).
Schwarz-Braun, leichter bräunlicher Schaum.
Aroma: gerösteter Malz, Bitterschokolade, Holz.
Geschmack: Gerösteter Malz, Schokolade, Lakritz.
Wenig Kohlensäure, cremig.

33cl Bottle @ 2D2Despuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Black colour with tan head.
Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, buttermilk, coffee.
Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, bitter.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Keg at Six Degrees North, Edinburgh. Dark brown body with ruby highlights and a dense tan head that holds well. Good lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate and wood. Flavour of lemon pith and chocolate. Medium body with a watery, smooth texture. Soft fizz. Very dry.
Keg at six degrees north Edinburgh.. Dark black... Small tan head... Dark dry woody chocolate roast malts nose.. Dark chocolate.. Woody malts.. Light pine roast.. Little charcoal... Little licorice
Tap at the Porterhouse, near black with a lasting creamy fine head, light coffee and red fruit nose, strong burnt bitterness in a dry creamy body.

Tap @ The Porterhouse, Dublin shared with Niilstrong. Opaque pitch black color, medium to full sized creamy beige head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is malts, dark malts, roasted malts. Taste malts, roasted malts, dark malts, heavy dark malt bitter, a touch of hop in there as well though the flavor is dominated by malt bitterness. Nice stout!
Excellent beer, aroma of dark fruits, molasses and roasted malts. Pours her black with a brown head. Low carbonation

Lo primero que llama la atención de esta cerveza es su chapa, que se abre con una anilla, como si fuera una granada. 
Color marrón profundo, pràcticamente opaco. Fantástica formación de espuma de café, muy cremosa y de burbuja pequeña (muy pequeña). Muy persistente y con muy buena adherencia, dejando un espectacular encaje de Bruselas. 
Intensa en nariz, da inmediatamente notas de chocolate y café. Entre las notas afrutadas, da algo de pasas muy suave. También algunas notas de tierra seca. No aprecio notas florales, herbales ni especiadas (aunque la verdad es que tengo la nariz un poquito taponada). 
El primer sabor que viene es el amargo, siempre de la mano de un punto de acidez. Hay también desde luego una nota de dulce, pero es francamente suave. 
Peso medio en boca y textura crujiente y algo picante, debido al amargor del torrefacto. En el retrogusto sale caramelo de café y algunas notas ligeramente acres, pero sobre todo, pan muy tostado. Persistencia en boca muy larga, liderada siempre por el amargor proveniente de la malta torrefacta. 
Una cerveza intensa de sabor y con carácter, aunque dando un resultado muy satisfactorio. De trago medio, maridará bien con chocolate y con casi cualquier cosa que vaya bien con pan tostado.

Draft Pint at The Porterhouse, Covent Garden, London in Feb 2011 - Very dry and nicely bitter stout. Very Dark Brown/Black in colour. Very Malty; burnt/roast malts, lots of bitter espresso coffee, some bitter chocolate, hint of liquorice. Hoppy; earthy hop bitterness. Rather dusty and ashy. Bittersweet with emphasis on the bitter. Very very dry throughout. Very burnt/roast taste. Good Stuff!! Terrific Stout! (2011-02-16)

Bottle from 99 cervezas. Dark brown to black. Brown head. Medium high bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body. Very dry body and finish. Aroma and flavour is liquorice, coffee, chocolate, cacao, fruity, spices, hops.
Отличны& сухой стаут, приятны& аромат и вкус, послевк& с горчинк& Годен до 15.12.2017. (Bottle 0,33/ 5%)

Dry stout, too bitter in my opinion. But a nice creamy mouthfeel with the nitrogen carbonation. All around slightly above average dry stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung).Fast schwarz mit dickem, dichtem Schaum. In Antrunk leicht säuerlich-malzig. Dann die wunderbare Verwandlung in Noten von schwarzer Schokolade.

0.33l bottle. Black body, light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, plums, chocolate, caramel and floral hops. Taste of chocolate, toast, floral hops, orange zest, plums and some berries. Very nice stout.

In Teku glass. Watching Comando Actualidad: El Imperio de la Cerveza This is a good dry stout and not guiness. Good body, dry finish and a pleasant coffelike roastyness that isnt overwhelming. Very creamy head although a bit big, which requires serving in 2 steps

Super dobry i wytrawny stout w starym stylu. Mimo wytrawnosci i szerokiej gamy chmielowej goryczy czuc palony slod ciemne owoce lesne. Likierowe piwo z chmielona glebia. Wyglad takze super, bezowa piana ladna srednio trwala i czarne ciemna jak bezgwiezdzista noc barwa. super do twardego sera dlugo dojrzewajacego

04-SEP-2016, bottle @Mortens.
Black with a lasting, tan head. Aroma of Caramel, licorice, buttermilk.
Taste the same. Sweet, milky, bitter, thin. OK.

Almost no aroma. Pours a black color with tan nitro head. Roasty flavor with a mild-to-light flavor.

Notes: St Patricks Day visit 10
Draught at the brewpub. Black colored. AROMA- roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. FLAVOR- neutral, slightly sour, bitter, roasted malts, coffee. Medium bodied. Nice Irish stout.

#759 Tap at Porterhouse Temple bar, Dublin. Absolutely black body, medium dark beige head. Aroma of roasted malst, hint of bread, milk chocolate. Taste is strongly bitter, dry, slightly sour. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, touch of plums. Medium to full body, moderately carbonated.Very good one!

My Bottom Line:
Roasted bitterness and acidity are balanced by chocolate cake icing in this bloated, super nitrogenated Stout.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A perfect head of creamy foam lingers all the way through the pint atop the pitch black.
-Malts are characterful enough to still convey a few coffee notes.
-This was served very cold.
-Mouthfeel is heavy, quite sweet, an impression enhanced by the intense nitrogen treatment.
-Differences between their Wrasslers Stout, Oyster Stout and Plain Porter are diminished because of the nitrogen.

On tap at their Temple Bar location.
On tap at porterhouse. Pitch black colour medium beige head. Nose is coffee and roasted malts. Taste is strange bitternes. Ugh. Lipidic bitterness. Undrinkable. Looked lovely but disappointed.
Ruikt lekker scouting. Superdonker, mooi vol schuim. Ruikt lekker naar chocola. Goed mondgevoel en lekkere gebalanceerde smaak. Top!
Muy rica dry-stout. Poderosa dentro de su estilo. Cuerpo sedoso, bonita presencia y un montón de maltas tostadas, torrefactas y toques ahumados en nariz y boca.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a beige head; aroma of roasted malt and chocolate with hints of dark fruits and coffee; taste is lightly sweet with chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malt, and hints of coffee; finish is dry with a hint of roasted bitterness; very good beer
UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 At Jim/John is back tasting. Dark brown w greyish head. Very dry bitter, chocolate malts, roastedness, dry leaves. Light sweet, medium bitter. Quite dry, medium body.

Bottle at the Jim / John is back tasting, Den Haag, April 2016. Poured almost black with a thin whispy light tan head. The aroma is rich roasty malt, some sweet creamy caramel. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter with a smooth creamy malt, liqourice, light floral hop palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at THT. Almost black with decent sized beige head. Lots of dried fruits, blueberries, dry cocoa powder and coffee dregs, quite some herbal hops and grass. Light sweet and medium bitter. Light bodied with dry watery feel.

33cl bottle shared at the Jim/John is back tasting
Very thin tan head. Clear black pour. A lovely dry stout
With the long tradition of producing excellent stouts my expectations for this one was set high, maybe too high. The roast aromas are there together with bready flavors. OK.
Black with creamy tan head. Licorice, espresso and slight burnt grain. Coffee, dry and burnt wood. Overall: nice and heavy.
Bottle, 330 ml, shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Pours black with creamy light brown head. Roasted malty, chocolate, dry bitter finish. Slightly metallic aroma. Medium bodied. Good one.

Aromas a café y carbón
Aspecto perfecto espuma densa y persistente
Muy torrefacto en boca. Café con final seco

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap at Les Berthom Lyon V, Lyon. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, lots of coffee, licorice, some chocolate, caramel. Sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Poured from an 11.2 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a black beer with a small tan head. The aroma is packed with chocolate malt and roasted nuts. The taste is a very nice smoky malt flavor.
Pours almost black and oily. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and a roasty hint. Malty, caramel taste with bitter finish. Nice and smooth.

L:
-pours the darkest of brown with no light coming through and a big,frothy,sand-coloured head
S:
-chocolate,oats,mocha,coffee,nutty,cream the nose with dried fruits and a toasty finish
-high espresso-like bitterniss
-dry finish
F:
-low to medium carbonation
-light to medium,creamy body
O:
Fantastic single Stout.

Black colour, it looks like old engine oil. Medium and stable head. Meidum intesive aroma of roasted malts, lots of dark chocolate, some dried fruits and hint of hops on background. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter and medium dry. Pleasant dry finish. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Tasty, dry, full of flavours stout.
Bottle. Black in colour, beige head.Very roasty, lots of chocolate and hoppy notes. Medium to light body, bitter and dry finish. Nice and hoppy dry stout.
Bottle. Dark brown color with low beige head. Aroma - Roasted malts, chocolate, grapes. Taste - Medium sweetness, malts, citrus, nuts, vanilla milk.

Black with airy light tan froth. Roasted and hoppy aroma with notes of dark chocolate, coffee and licorice. Roasted flavour with coffee and strong, lasting bitterness. Ok but mouthfeel is a little too light.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2015 Bottle bbe 19.12.15. Dark brown beer with brownish head. Roasty and intense caramelly aroma. Taste is pretty dry with dark malts, caramel and coffee. Nicely balanced stout with a long dry/bitter finish.
Pitch black with thick foamy head. Roasty aroma with hints of liquorice. Balanced taste and a long bitter finish. Texture is oily but not in excess, very drinkable.

Aromat: sporo estrów oraz niestety oznaki utlenienia (miód, mokry karton), choć data przydatności upływa za ponad 2 miesiące. Są oczywiście nuty stoutowe, jak czekolada gorzka, kawa zbożowa czy palność, wzbogacone w tym przypadku owsem. Lekki , ziołowy powiew chmielu.


Wygląd: barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa (początkowo zbita), obfita, jakby zbyt, ale trwała i ładnie oblepiająca szkło.


Smak: bardzo wytrawny, raczej kwaskowy niż słodki. Następnie czekolada gorzka, paloność, kawa. Goryczka zdecydowanie powyżej średniej, wsparta przez ciemne słody. Jest ona szczypiąca i długa, na granicy zalegania, ale w tym przypadku się sprawdza. Niska do średniej pełnia, umiarkowane do niskiego wysycenie i kwaskowo- palony finisz.

Bottle 33 cl. Black color with tan foam. Aroma: roasted barley, caramel, dark malts, coffee with brandy and good floral hop. Taste: dry with strong notes of roasted barley, bitter chocolate and black coffee without sugar, strong hoppy and bitter aftertaste. Very good.

On tap at Porterhouse Central. Pitch-black with a solid white head. Heavy bitterness based on roasted barley and backed with an almost unusual hop-bitterness of the style. Nice hoppy and malty aromas. Classy.

Black color, small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt and light chocolate. Dry bitter taste has roasted malts, coffee, hops and light citrus and smoke. Medium body and soft carbonation. Nice hoppy dry stout.

Keg in the Porterhouse Temple Bar, Dublin. Black with a good lasting beige head. Little aroma. Ashy flavour with very light spice leading to rich chocolate. Ash returns in the lingering finish. Creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle off licence Prague. Black tan head choc roast malt aroma taste same dry smokey bitter finsh. Ok body. Decent.

(Bottle) Black body with a big brown head. Roasted malt aroma, dark chocolate, dried fruit. Medium- to full-bodied, creamy mouthfeel; a little bit of a numbing sensation in the mouth. Flavor is bitter, moderately sweet, chocolate, espresso. Dry, roasty finish. Rich and smooth, very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2015 Maker: Porterhouse Brewing, Dublin, Ireland ***
Beer: Porterhouse Wrasslers XXXX Stout ***
Style: Dry Stout ***
ALC.VOL.: 5.7% ***

"Made to a recipe originally brewed by Deasys of West Cork in the early 1900s. This was Michael Collins favourite tipple - a stout like your grandfather used to drink. A fine fullsome stout, full in every way, a pungent aroma of late kettle hops." [brewery notes] ***

Colour: Reddish dark brown with big, dark beige head. ***
Nose: Chocolate, nuts, licorice, vanilla. ***
Texture: Light to medium body, still watery. Mild carbonation. ***
Taste: Roasted malt. Coffee. A hint of vanilla. Very dry and bitter right from the start. Very bitter chocolate ("Herrenschokolade"). A little milder towards the middle, but still with coffee notes dominating. Finale turns a wee bit sour, like when youre actually munching on coffee beans. Long, bitter espresso aftertaste. ***

Impressions: Very good dry stout, and dry it certainly is. Those who prefer stouts that are clearly different from porters (i.e. no milk chocolate or toffee in the taste) should love this one. My only gripe: A little more body would be great.

Draft at the source with the family. Pours a deep black body with thick creamy brown head and lacing. Mouthfeel is rich and creamy with notes of rich roast, dry toasty character and coffee/chocolate. Nice hop profile to balance the roast.

Ring-pull cap bottle 33cl. Fully opaque black, small creamy light brown head, settles quickly, good lacing; roasted malt nose, dark chocolate, coffee, spicy notes; taste full bitter, slightly sweet, roasted, chocolate, coffee; medium body, oily to creamy texture, lingering roasted bitter aftertaste, bit smoky, chocolate, spicy notes; a well-balanced and tasty Bitter Stout.
Bottle 33cl from le Barboteur, @ home. A nice stout, very bitter with a touch of acidity and some astringency. Quite dry, smoky.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Flaska drucken med Daniel. En kraftig välgjord tung stout fylld med rostade smaker i bra balans, bra rund munkänsla. Mycket choklad, rostad malt, toner av lakrits och kaffe. Lagom sötma, fin kropp och beska.

Flaska drucken med Petrus. En kraftig välgjord tung stout fylld med rostade smaker i bra balans, bra rund munkänsla. Mycket choklad, rostad malt, måttlig sötma och beska. Bryggeriets bästa jag druckit hittills.
Bottle at Stuus. Pours opaque brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of prunes, liquorice. Taste is more of the same, with chocolate notes and soy. Slightly thin.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is sweet chocolate, toffee, taste is quite dry, chocolate, roasted, sweet.
Casi negra. Dos dedos de espuma beige. Aroma algo agrio. Compleja en boca, muy ahumada. Muy muy seca. Diferente. No me acaba de convencer. Quizás un nuevo intento...
Draft pour at the source. The beer is a dark brown to black with a khaki head. The aroma has chocolate, ash, and some coffee. Taste is sweet and mildly bitter. Medium body and medium carbonation.

On tap at the Porterhouse Bar. Comes almost black with a nice rich creamy khaki head. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, barley, chocolate, and coffee. Finish is somewhat dry with a little bitterness. Nice.

On tap at The Porterhouse, pours jet black with a small brown head. Nose brings out roasted malt and cocoa. Flavour is rich, with lightly roasted malt and dry cocoa. Quite a lovely palate, full of dry cocoa. Silky, thick palate. Very nice stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 The beer has a lovely stout appearance. The color of the beer is a beautiful pitch black, with a nice ruby red glow. The beer pours a delicious soft creamy white head of foam. The foam remains on top of the beer for quite a long time. The creamy layer of foam that remains looks delicious and seals all the aromas in. The beer smells like a proper stout. There are slightly salty aromas of roasted barley, coffee and chocolate. The taste confirms this. There is a nice citrusy hop aroma in the finish. The beer has something special, maybe a smoky sensation. Its a delicious robust stout, with a youth of freshness in the finish. One of the better stouts in the world, I my opinion. Its nice, very nice.

Magnifique Irish Stout qui offre un nez magnifique aux fortes effluves de malts grillés et fortement torréfié aux relents de café fraîchement moulu, de chicorée, de chocolat avec une petite pointe acide. En bouche, japprécie beaucoup ce maltage à la fois costaud aux saveurs torréfiées assez dense avec un arrière goût de brûlé léger mais bien présent, et à la fois onctueux au palais grâce à des saveurs lactées qui rendent cette dégustation assez douce. La surprise arrive en rétro-nasale avec un houblonnage assez solide: à la fois résineux et herbacé. Le tout avec une belle longueur en bouche. Dommage cette petite astringence surette qui arrive en toute fin. A la fois apéritive et désaltérante.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tulip Glass. Supplier: Porterhouse (Dublin). Fruity taste with dark roasted overtones.
27.1.2015. Taste has dryish, dark roasted malts. Taste is very roasty or burnt. Not my thing.

Una stout dal colore impenetrabile e la schiuma compatta, colore del caffelatte. Aromi di cioccolato e liquerizia. Nel complesso bilanciata. Finale un poco astringente e carbonazione un po oltre la norma.
Pourse black with big off white/tan head. Lots of chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Same again in taste, coffee, chocolate.. quite a dry finish. Really really good stout

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Authentic Irish dry stout outside the Guinness - Murphys - Beamish triangle, apparently appreciated by the holy Michael Jackson in the late nineties and a recreation of an early 20th-century example, very curious about this. The cap has a ring to it, for easy removal. Pours a completely opaque black colour under a thick, moussy, thickly lacing, medium beige head. Aroma shouts tons of cookie dough at first, accompanied by hints of cappuccino, caramel candy, gingerbread, liquorice candy, pronounced iron, mocha, candied figs, cloves, chicory. Concentrated dried fruits flavour at first, with a fatty, oily, smooth mouthfeel, faintly sweet but nothing really reminiscent of candi or other sugar, dry with a soft, sweetish nutty and chocolatey maltiness, clear but not really disturbing iron, light spiciness, finishing in a full-fledged coffeeish and chicory-like roasted bitterness lasting for a long time and aided by peppery and earthy hop bitterness. Appetizing, dry and with indeed an authentic feel to it (inasmuch as this is assessible - given the fact no one alive today was around when Michael Collins drank the original version); very good in its particular style, feeling more natural than Guinness Draught, for example. Kudos to Porterhouse, apparently the first Irish brewpub.
Smells of barley and black malts. Body and carbonation are good but this is extremely dry without the burnt flavor typical with black malt. Its good but....

Bottle, 30/01/15. Pousr a dark brown, almost black with a wooden tinge. Fairly small, light latte-colored head. Aroma is burnt rubber, roast, chocolate. Taste is roast and coffee, some chocolate. Light with good carbonation. Good with spicy roast chicken. Excellent drinkability.
Smells of leather, pitch black body with no head, dry earthy smokey very decent stout.

Draft sample at Hopcat GR - pours a dark brown with faint white head . Nice roast character , smooth body ... Super sessionable . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from clongriffen carry out. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is Bog, manure, wood, earth. Flavour is light roasted malts with dry earthy coffee finish. Light body.

Noire, mousse chocolat moyenne se tenant assez bien. Nez de petit déjeuner : pain grillé et café. Les saveurs sont légères : café, malts grillés. Cest au niveau de lamertume que cest costaud : grosse amertume sèche persitente, pregnante qui permet aux notes torréfiées de se développer sur la langue et le palet. Très bonne dry stout, pour les amateurs ...

Cerveza de color negro oscuro con una cabeza de color marrón claro.
Aroma a malta tostada y a chocolate.
Sabor a malta tostadas, a café, a chocolate, con un paladar suave que finaliza con el amargor y el tostado.
Una muy buena cerveza Irlandesa, muy sabrosa.

Pours out dark black with a thin beige head and solid lacing rings. The nose is malted heavily with big roasted notes and hits of dark choc. A nice robust flavour with notes of dark choc. and espresso. The finish is dry and quite bitter with a lingering roasted note.

330ml bottle (5,6%). Very dark brown, almost black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Gentle roast, sweet, chocolate, grainy and touch of hops in aroma. Nice roast, grainy, hazelnuts, bitter hops in taste. Full body. Slightly dry mouthfeel. Medium bitterness. Very drinkable.

Draught at the brewpub, Dublin. Clear black with a nitro head. Roasted malt aroma, some dark chocolate. The flavour is dominated by roasted malt, harshly roasted malt, with a bitter and ashy final. A bit unpleasant. Smooth mouthfeel but light-bodied.
Keg at Porterhouse, Covent Garden, London. A black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, chocolate, dry and quite bitter.

Bottle. Very dry stout. Black body, small briwn head, ling nice palate. Very interesting!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle @ Melkebaren. Black body with a rather small, but stable beige head. Strong, good aroma of roasted malt, expresso coffee, mocha and some dry fruit. Nice, strong flavor as well, mostly the same ingredients as found in the aroma, medium sweet, nicely roasted dark malt, dark chocolate, coffee, medium bitterness with a hint of salt liquorice. Nice balanced and impressive complexity for such low ABV. Fine body and long, good aftertaste. Impressive all the way.

Black beer, creamy beige head. Nose is dark chocolate, burned notes, malt, licorice. Flavor is bitter-roasty, malts, acidic touches. Bitter finish with citrus tones. The roasty bitterness is thick, almost chewy. Solid stuff.

Heres one Id go back to often if it werent for the hefty price tag. Complex aroma and flavor of malted chocolate, roasted coffee, dark fruit, and slight smoke and licorice. Theres a slight twangy creaminess that adds to the body but takes away just a touch from the still great aroma and flavor. Best Porterhouse Ive had. Why couldnt the oyster stout be like this?"

11.2 oz. bottle (if I recall correctly), consumed on 9-15-14. Scents of chocolate, plum, chocolate-covered raisin, chocolate-covered cherry, Playdough, cookie dough, bran muffin, and orange. Smells good and interesting. Pours dark brown with a moderate amount of tan head. Roasted malt flavors of dark chocolate, coffee, Playdough, and char. Slightly artificial taste. Tarry finish and aftertaste. Roasted bitter aftertaste. Light to medium body. Lively and frothy in the palate. Overall, interesting and aromatic but pulled down by the seemingly artificial element in aroma and flavor. Better than I expected.

0,33L bottle, BB 29.07.15. Pours dark brown-black with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, roast, chocolate. Flavor is roast, coffee, licorice, some sour notes. Finish is very long roasted dry and coffee bitter with some smokiness and nutiness. Overall: well made brew, but I prefer my stouts sweeter.

Bottled.ABV 5.7 %. Pours opaque black with an average, creamy and lacing beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, coffee and hops. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice stout.

Draught, opaque dark brown to black colour, medium long lasting, creamy head, aroma of coffee and strong roasted malt with some dirt and a hint of seaweed, flavour of coffee nuts and peanuts with some smokiness in the back and something sea salty like. Very good traditional stout.
Tap, dark pour, off white head, nose is toffee and caramel, taste is bitter chocolate, nice.

Das Bier hat ein kräftiges Röstaroma mit Anklängen von Kaffee, Beerenfrüchten und sanftem Räuchergeruch. Die Schaumkrone steht wie Schlagsahne. Geschmack dann relativ bitter, adstringierend. Nachgeschmack von Räucherschinken.
(cask, at Porterhouse, Temple Bar) Geruch eher neutral, schade. Geschmack dann kräftiger, mit Aschenbecher.

Pint at Porterhouse Temple Bar, Dublin (4.90):
Strong bitterness, coffee & toasted notes with caramel backing them up. Some milk chocolate & earthy notes feature with some grain & touches of sweetness.

Opaque black with a thumb-sized, creamy & beige head with great retention.

Bitter tasting with some coffee & chocolate, touches of milk & sweetness plus burnt toast, grain & earthy malts with caramel too.

Smooth with only hints of grain. Lightly carbonated & sweet with a dry finish & bitterness that lingers at the end.

Not a bad effort from Porterhouse but not quite up to the standard set by their Oyster Stout that I tried previously, mainly due to the fact that the bitterness was a little overpowering but it was enjoyable at least.
Mørk brun/svart farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av kaffe, lakris og tjære. Smak av mørk røstet maltt, kaffe og lakris. Melkebaren.
Duft av kaffe og lakris. dyp sort farge. Tynt lag skum som forsvinner, noe heng langs kant. God smak av kaffe.

A bottle, 33 cl. A black beer with a beige and big head. The nose has roastiness, coffee, some sweetness of chocolate, also hint of dark fruits. Taste is roasted and quite dry but not too much, thus not burned, black coffee, hint of fruits. At least medium bodied, smooth carbonation, nice and slippery to drink. A very strong flavours, lots of roastiness and coffee, good.

33 cl bottle.
Pours black color with a large, lasting beige head. Nice orange-y hoppy aroma, faint mint notes, some oat and dark malts with dark chocolate. Bitter malty palate, roasted notes, dry cocoa powder, orange, some faint vanilla notes as well as some caramel. Tangy bitter malty palate with a short, hop-driven dry finish. Very tasty, the fruity hops work on this quite well.
3425

(bottle - 330 ml) Dark black pour with a thin tan head. Chocolate and mocha coffee aroma with some very light caramel and hop bitterness. Flavor is rich and roasty at the start with a very dry and bitter finish. Light espresso aftertaste.

Black bodied, stable head. Not quite as rich in aroma as expected, but I do like the dry twig/woody appeal. Dry cacao and roasted malts. Very well developed and very bitter. Nice one, really my kind of brew. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Maybe I got one on the shelf too long, but very sour. Balance wasnt there. Love dark beers heavy hopped, but this didnt work. Coffee and sour taste.

330 mml bottle tasted on 02/06/2014. Black colour with a nice and creamy beige head. Aroma is roasty and sweet. Taste is intense bitter, chocolate and toast. Aftertaste is very high and good. A little dry in the finish but a very good stout. Michael Higgins was right about this beer. The label and the glass of the brewery are awesome! Next one please.
UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Bottle at home - poured black with a tan head that persisted. Aroma of coffee and notes of fire ashes. Taste is roasty with coffee notes. Medium mouth feel. This is pretty good.

BOTTLE 33CL from dcmchew. Thanks, Cristian Mihai.

Look: pitch black with a beige head.
Aroma: sweetish aroma of creme brulee, toast, light roast, yeast.
Taste: some sweetness and hop character comes through the roast with and acid note, very (too?) bitter, ashy finish.
Smell of coffee, tar. Black colour, light brown creamy head. Aroma of tar, ash, coffee. Dry, ashy texture. Bitter. Flat and soft carbon. Excellent.

Keg at Porterhouse Covent Garden. Short review due to socialising. Black, big foamy brown head endures and leaves full lacing. Aroma - malty, yeast, ash. Body is medium, smooth, touch of carbonation. Taste - deep roast, ash. Nice stout.

Smooth with hints of sourness in the beginning. The mainpart is very intense, probably a bit viscous. Roasted-sourish. The aftertaste is burned coffee, dark chocolate and nice bitter hints. --> Interesting, but for me a bit too concentrated-viscous. --> 10/12/11/11

Deep black color with tan medium head. Aroma is roasty, light acidic on the nose, mostly sweet butter character. Taste has high noble bitterness in opening, maybe too much for my taste, but it goes into the background as I finish my pint. The balanced sweet side has a lot of roastiness too, with light dark chocolate ending. Definitely balanced towards the bitter side, makes the palate little bit flat. Body is light with medium carbonation.

12oz bottle from Dark Horse. Pours an oily thick black into the tulip glass, very little head, just leaves a thin tan cream on top, some lacing down the glass. Aroma of dark fruit, toast, cocoa, coffee, some molasses. Flavor is the same, slightly thinner than I was expecting. Palate is full and oily, extremely smooth and easy to drink.
Tiefschwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Kaffee, Schokolade. Geschmack röstmalzig trocken nach Kaffee, leicht würzig und herb.

330 ml bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours nearly pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, coffee, molasses, light herbal, and roast/bready earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roasted/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, light molasses, light herbal, and roasted earthiness. Good amount of sharp roasted/earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, light molasses, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice balance, robustness, and complexity of roasted/bready malt and moderate earthy hop flavors; with a crisp malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and fairly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming presence after the finish. Overall this is an excellent dry stout style. All around great balance and complexity of roast/bready malt and moderate earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Tap at Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki. Originally rated 12112011. Colour is almost black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, some chocolate and roasted malts.

On tap at the wharf. Deep clear black with ruby edges and a silky tan head. Aroma of coffee and roasted items. Flavour is malty and strongly but smoothly bitter. Silky mouthfeel and medium body. Finish is almost big and definitely bitter, maybe from hops but probably the black patent malt.
Drought. Inky black with creamy chocolate colored head, milk aroma, coffee beans and milk taste, low carbonation, longish finish with a bit of bitterness on your palate. Very much like Caffreys

Aroma: dark chocolate, toasted malt, but not overpowering. Appearance: dark brown/black, creamy brown medium head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters continue, some citrus appearing, medium carbonation, roasted flavours. Overall: nice Dry Stout, lovely chocolate aroma. Pint at the Porterhouse Covent Garden, London.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Chocolate smell. A bitter chocolate taste. A dry and bitter aftertaste, but a solid beer.

On tap @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Pours black with nice creamy tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Some fruity aromas, among roasty and coffee ones. Medium body, soft carbonation, silky texture. On mouth is sweet, fruity at the beggining, then roasty, coffe, quite dry. End very dry. Balanced and quite enjoyable.

A light smell of malt, not much else. The body is black, the head has a normal size, it is pale beige and milky. It has a strong taste of roasted malt and coffee, quite bitter finish. The body is medium to very strong, very creamy with a soft carbonation. A very good Stout!

330ml bottle with an interesting pull tab. Black with a thin covering of brown foam. Aroma of dark malt and vanilla lightness. Taste led by cocoa and chocolate malt before dryness kicks in. Technically fine, but not too exciting on the whole.
Pitch black with a nice sturdy creamy head. Not sweet a lot of flavour. A splendid dry stout. From tap at Porterhouse Dublin.

Taster on tap at Delirium Brussels, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, little stable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, chocolate, toffee.
TASTE: coffee, bitter aftertaste, not really balanced in total...

25 cl. draft @ Delrium Tap House. Black with an okay mocha head. Nose is sweet caramel with typical mocha, coffee & chocoalte but not very impressive nose. Taste is sweet coffee, middling, caramel, herbs, bit of toffee & coffee, sweet sugar, solid malt presence,... Med. to light for style body. Solid effort but not the best around. Now seeing that this is a "Dry Stout" I am far more possitive about this. I gave this 0,1 more for style.

From bottle, courtesy of John C. Mild roasted nutty nose, chocolate, coffee, and light bitter hops. Some vanilla and caramel. Dark black opaque with thin tan head. Medium bodied with medium-high carbonation. Starts pretty dry with roasted-burnt malt, and hop bitterness. Light coffee and chocolate, some vanilla sweetness. Finish is fairly smooth with carbonic bit and bitter hop after.
August 2010. From bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Roasted malt aromas with dark fruit, molasses, chocolate. Medium body with a smooth finish.
Voilà une vraie Stout ! Épaisse, harmonieuse, douce... et qui laisse une gentil souvenir de son passage en bouche.
Brown black pour with clinging tan head and lace. Aroma is light chocolate and roasted malt. Sweet chocolate start with a burnt coffee like bitter. Light bodied with good carbonation. ok

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark brown in colour with a small tan head. Rich chocolate aroma, very dry, with a very bitter finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. A good beer, but could do with a little more body to it.

330ml bottle 5.7% version from Beers of Europe - Pitch black body, frothy tan head. Nose is a rich coffee, roasted malt, liquorice and bitter chocolate. Also picking blackcurrants up too. The taste is a bit like those blackcurrant and liquorice sweets, sweet to start with and a lasting bitter finish. Palate lets this one down, a bit thin and watery. A bit more robust and this would be a cracker. Still very nice though.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, light beige head, with some lacing, over a clear, reddish black (SRM 40) body.....nose is roasted malts with coffee, lighter chocolate, light hints of toffee, hop spice.....taste is roasted malts with chocolate, coffee, lighter malts with hints of caramel, molasses, leading to a moderately heavy hop bitter bite.....mouth feel thick, creamy, light astringency, carbonation leads to a clean light acid finish. This is a lovely, fairly well balanced Stout with a delightful richness. The finishing bitterness is too dominant. BJCP 8/3/13/5/6

Keg @ Porterhouse Central Dublin [140813]
Black, ruby edges, tan dense head, good lacing
Aroma - Soft dark malts, roasted malts, touch spicy
Taste - Dark bitter roast, dark chocolate, spicy hop, coffee grounds, good taste spoiled by the aggressive burnt finish
Palate - Soft carb, medium body. Finish - Bitter bitter roast, dry, loooong linger, too much burnt roast 
Overall - The finish is way too burnt and bitter for me - rather disappointed with this -  not a fan ...must try the bottle and see if its better
Very nice stout. Lots of roasted malts. Coffee. Chocolate. Pours a very dark brown. Almost no head. Very nice beer.
The best of the Porterhouse stouts I tried. Looked the same as the others (like a Guinness), but much more nose and taste. Roasted malts, hops, lovely bitterness. Quality stuff.

På fat @ Porthouse Central, Dublin. Svart öl med gräddigt moccafärgat skum. Det blir inte vackrare. Svagt rostade toner, kaffe och choklad i aromen. Smaker av soja, lakrits, mörk choklad, vanilj och spår av rökighet. Ljuvligt gräddig munkänsla.
Tap at Porterhouse Temple Bar, Dublin: Opaque black brew with an dry bitter taste of roasted malts and coffee.
Nitro draft. Dark pour with a cascading head. Mild stout and roasted malt aromas. Velvet like mouthfeel. Roasted and dry malts fill this stouts flavor.

330ml bottle pours black in color with a light brown head that leaves some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is roasted grains with hints of coffee and chocolate.  Taste is a bold roasted grain, coffee and hop bitterness with a dark chocolate sweetness.  Medium to heavy body with some decent carbonation.  One of the best Irish stouts that I have sampled to date, well done.
The head is robust and creamy, body black. It smells roasty, coffee, a bit creamy. The taste is bitter, aromatic, coffe, roasty, maybe vegetable-bitter, Delicious and interesting. 15/12/13/13/-/13
Poured from bottle at Wilde. Black pour with tan head. Earthy farm taste. Bourbon flavor. Having a hard time drinking it
Bottle. Dark amber/ruby. Nice head. Chocolate and coffee taste. Dry aftertaste.

Bottle from Beers of Europe into a Gouden Carolus glass.  Black with a fair creamy brown head.  Nice chocolate malt aroma with hops.  Malty, hint of sweetness, and lovely rich roast after-taste.  Very nice, excellent beer of its class.
(12/2011) tap, old rating. Thick creamy excellent coffee.-- bb/h(n9)
Draught @ Porterhouse.  This was the best of the porterhouse stouts i tried.  An excellent Irish dry.

Some graininess and heft to the aroma. Looks great. The flavor is all over the place but it works. Thick roasty malt, some smoke and a quite a bit of sweet hops on the back end. Pairs perfectly with the macadamias Im eating
Excellent.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2013 Láhev 330 ml. Po nalití příjemné aroma kávy s nádechem chmele. Pěna má velmi jemné bublinky a je nízká vzhledem ke stylu  piva vypadá velmi přitalivě a je lehce nahnědlé barvy. Barva samotného piva je temně černá a nepropoutí světlo. Po prvním ochutnání hořkost piva která velmi připomíná silnou kávu, přehluuje ostatní chutě v první chvíly ale po opadnutí nastává velmi příjemná chuť, sytého a tělnatého stoutu přesně tak jak to má člověk rád. Pitelnost je nií ne třeba u Guinnesse.

Bottle: Very dark amber coloured, ruby spots detectable,mid-sized loose tanned head, dried dark fruits, roasted malt, ashes and freshly ground coffee in the bitter nose; solid dry bitter flavour, barely medium bodied; heavily lingering bone-dry coffeeish and bitter finish. Wow, what a Stout

Pitch black with a rocky khaki head.  Aromas of dry irish roast malt, raisin, and slightly burnt cocoa.  Flavor is as if someone dried and burned something that used to be sweet, now is acrid and charred.  Smokey roasiness overwhelms the palate with a little sweet dark chocolattiness filtering through, a touch of licorice, and a little bitter earthiness.  Not a fan, and certainly not worth $4.79+tax for an 11oz bottle.

The full caressing body is beautifully balanced with the tingle of tasty sourness complimenting a very long and very satisfying almost earthy dryness. Every element is there to be tasted yet they merge to make a delicious whole

330ml bottle. Dark cola colour, tiny bit of ruby around the edges, milk chocolate head. Aroma is dark chocolate, milk chocolate, roast barley and coffee. Taste is much the same, with some strong roasted coffee aftertaste. Body is thick and creamy without any wateriness. Overall, best dry stout Ive had, especially the body.
Bitter and quite hoppy. Has a strong hop smell, as well. Chocolate and coffee notes. Pours a very dark brown with a large light brown head.

On tap at the Temple Bar location in Dublin. Pours a black tan as exspected. Aroma is oatmeal , Charcoal and coco. Very nice. Taste is a smooth mellow semi sweet stout. Palate is also mellow but spicy. Palate is very nice.

Bottle. Near black pour with a finger-thick brown head. Thickly roasty, heaps of espresso bean, bitter bakers chocolate, light soy sauce, nutty nuances. The finish is filled with a drying hoppy bitterness, very assertive-- almost too much so, but not quite. I really loved this stout.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draught at the Porterhouse Cork. Pours a deep black with thick tan head. Aroma is lost in nitro head, hints of coffee and nut. Taste is strong bitter with a light sweetness - coffee, brazil nut, hint of lemon. Palate is full and thick bodied, lingering bitter, smooth and slightly dry. A really great and powerful stout.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse. Pours an opaque black/brown. Tan head. Big, rich aroma, malt forward but slightly herbal. Syrupy, sweet almost milk chocolate-like richness to body, maybe a touch of of molasses as well. Finish slightly sweet, just a bit of nutty bitterness at very end. Really lovely.
Nicim vyjimecny stout. Tedy krome nazvu. Ginis je lepsi, vyraznejsi. Lahvac z pivonky.

(bottle, 33cl, 5.7% abv) Black coloured hue with a brown and firm mid-sized foamy head. Moderately sweet and roasted malty aroma with notes of liquorice, chocolate, vanilla, a whiff of smoke and traces of sweaty hops. Roasty bitter flavour with a tinge of malty sweetness, medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. Solid roasty malty base with notes of dark chocolate, liquorice and caramel/burnt sugar; quite dry and roasty bitter finish with a lasting aftertaste of dark chocolate, liquorice and herbal hoppy flavours. Pleasantly complex Stout. 15.II.13

Bottle.   Poured a very dark brown with medium full head that maintained. Aroma of cocoa, roasted malt, vanilla. Has a dry bitter finish. Medium light body.  Slight chalk. Nice mouthfeel. A full flavored stout.
Nice smoky malt aroma. Dark chocolate and mocha. Pours black with carpet lacing. Good Irish stout. Low carbonation, thick consistency. Finishes bitter with a touch of sour. Tap at Blue Monk.

Keg @ Porterhouse. The pours black with a small, tight off-white head. The nose is general roasted grain, ash, light bitter chocolate and a bit of singed grass. The taste is more roasted malts. Ashed wood. General earthy flavors. A light touch of chocolate for balance. Dry, slightly hoppy finish. This drinks smoothly. Supple body. Overall, this was by far the best Porterhouse beer I had on visit. Quite a solid dry stout.
Beautiful black pour with a foamy tan head. Coffe, bourbon and hint of chocolate, nice bitter taste.
